intro: Eumorpha grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered sphinx, is a striking species of moth found in the neotropical region. It belongs to the family Sphingidae and is characterized by its large size and distinctive wing patterns. The plant is known for its showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bats and moths. Its floral structure is adapted for nocturnal pollination, featuring strong scents and nectar-rich blooms. Eumorpha grandiflora plays an important ecological role in its habitat by supporting a variety of pollinators and contributing to plant reproduction.
